title: PARADISE SLAVES Announce Debut Album
description: Packing a good ol' metal punch, Paradise Slaves debut record is due out this summer. The post PARADISE SLAVES Announce Debut Album appeared first on Metal Injection.
author: Isabella Ambrosio
byline: By Isabella Ambrosio Published 2 hours ago
excerpt: Packing a good ol' metal punch, Paradise Slaves debut record is due out this summer.
text: Paradise Slaves may be a brand new band, but this isn't the members' first rodeo. The band's dynamic lineup formed back in 2024, consisting of vocalist Brock Lindow (36 Crazyfists), guitarist Tyler Stroetzel (solo), guitarist Jon Kita (Diecast), bassist Brad Horion (Diecast), and drummer Ryan Manning (Pentagram, Blitzkid), and they didn't waste time putting pen to paper. Paradise Slaves have just announced their debut record, With Hell In His Eyes, due out on the 2nd of May. And despite only having formed last year, the five-piece have already shared the stage with bands like Killswitch Engage, Three Days Grace, Fit For An Autopsy, and Death Ray Vision. Packing a good ol' metal punch, the album will have an appearance from Unearth's vocalist Trevor Phillips and a Soul Asylum cover of "Somebody to Shove." You can find the track listing below. You can also pre-order the record here. "For Those Who Watch the Sea" "Aesthetic of Serpents" "A Fever to Defeat" "Dreamers" "With Hell In His Eyes" "Glass Mountain" "Swim North" (featuring Trevor Phillips) "How Far From Fragile" "Somebody to Shove" (Soul Asylum cover) "Always Have Always Will" Want More Metal? html:
Paradise Slaves may be a brand new band, but this isn't the members' first rodeo. The band's dynamic lineup formed back in 2024, consisting of vocalist Brock Lindow (36 Crazyfists), guitarist Tyler Stroetzel (solo), guitarist Jon Kita (Diecast), bassist Brad Horion (Diecast), and drummer Ryan Manning (Pentagram, Blitzkid), and they didn't waste time putting pen to paper.

Paradise Slaves have just announced their debut record, With Hell In His Eyes, due out on the 2nd of May. And despite only having formed last year, the five-piece have already shared the stage with bands like Killswitch Engage, Three Days Grace, Fit For An Autopsy, and Death Ray Vision.

Packing a good ol' metal punch, the album will have an appearance from Unearth's vocalist Trevor Phillips and a Soul Asylum cover of "Somebody to Shove."

You can find the track listing below. You can also pre-order the record here.

  1. "For Those Who Watch the Sea"
  2. "Aesthetic of Serpents"
  3. "A Fever to Defeat"
  4. "Dreamers"
  5. "With Hell In His Eyes"
  6. "Glass Mountain"
  7. "Swim North" (featuring Trevor Phillips)
  8. "How Far From Fragile"
  9. "Somebody to Shove" (Soul Asylum cover)
  10. "Always Have Always Will"
